definition: the left-radical form of Kangxi radical 145, 衣[yi1]
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
(old) combat robe/soldier's uniform/(sports) team jersey/team shirt
lit. to take the yellow gown (idiom)/fig. to be made emperor/to take the crown
fur-lined changpao 長袍|长袍[chang2 pao2]
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom)/to break all friendly ties
Chinese-style long robe worn as outermost garment/burqa

sentences.english: There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
sentences.chinese: 有一个财主穿著紫色袍和细麻布衣服，天天奢华宴乐。

sentences.english: Had dI the heavens' embroidered cloths, inwrought with golden and silver light.
sentences.chinese: 假若我有天神的绣袍，镶嵌着金光和银光。

sentences.english: Won't you put on that other gown and bonnet again,--you know the ones I mean?
sentences.chinese: 你不打算再穿你那件裙袍，戴你那顶帽子了吗？

sentences.english: Arms outspread, the completed robe with hood will form an "Ankh."
sentences.chinese: 伸开双臂，完成袍罩将形成一个“十字章。”

sentences.english: Judge Hiller: Damn right I am. That's why I wear the robe.
sentences.chinese: 你吹涨么，法官件袍就是这么穿的。

sentences.english: Night wears a black cloak lined with fire, studded inside with gleaming stars.
sentences.chinese: 夜穿着火滚边的黑袍，袍内缀满闪烁的星星。

sentences.english: She was then wearing a plush hat and her merino gown.
sentences.chinese: 当时她戴的是一顶棉绒帽，穿的是一件粗毛呢裙袍。

sentences.english: Flows in the scrolls of her toga.
She'd always been inclined to dress in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 以前她总是倾向于穿着黑色或白色的修女袍。

sentences.english: She gives me over to Grandfather who removes the deerskin robe and sprinkles His "holy water" over me.
sentences.chinese: 她让我交给谁清除的祖父和鹿皮袍洒他的圣水超过我。

sentences.english: Instead he wore a simple robe of grey and blue.
sentences.chinese: 作为替代他穿了一身简单的蓝灰袍。

sentences.english: A storm is only as the outskirts of His robe, the symptom of His advent, the environment of His presence.
sentences.chinese: 风浪是神义袍的边襟，再临的征候，同在的证据。

sentences.english: The sheep fur-lined robe my mom made is extremely warm.
sentences.chinese: 袍是妈妈亲手做的，我穿着特别暖和。

definition: purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
robe of a Buddhist priest/ceremonial garment of a Daoist priest/robe of a judge, nun, priest etc/cassock/vestment
garment/jacket with open slits in place of sleeves
black (without gloss)/black with a hint of red in it
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
